# Data Prep

We will use the BEA average wages and salaries. Average wages and salaries are wages and salaries divided by total wage and salary employment.

<br>

```{r avg wages}
avg.wage.original <- read_csv('/Users/kellyasche/Library/CloudStorage/GoogleDrive-kasche@ruralmn.org/My Drive/Research/FY25-27/FY25/OHE Journey to meaningful employment/Data/Income/Master-avg-wages-county.csv')

kable(names(avg.wage.original))

kable(head(avg.wage.original))
```

<br>

The dataset above provides the graduation year along with the three year rolling average of the average salary and wages for each county. Next, in order to hold these values constant over time, we will be calculating the three year averages as a percentage of the state average over that same time period.

<br>

```{r avg percent of state}
avg.wage.pct.state <- avg.wage.original %>%
  group_by(hs.grad.year) %>%
  mutate(avg.wages.pct.state = wages.3year.avg / wages.3year.avg[countyfp == "000"]) %>%
  ungroup()

kable(names(avg.wage.pct.state))

```

<br>

Now we just need to join it with the original.

<br>

```{r avg wages join with master}
master.12 <- read_csv("Data/SLEDS/Masters/Master-12.csv")

master.13 <- master.12 %>%
  left_join(avg.wage.original, by = c("hs.grad.year", "countyfp"))

avgwages.master <- read_csv("Data/SLEDS/Masters/Master-1.csv") %>%
  select(PersonID, grad.year, countyfp) %>%
  left_join(avg.wage.pct.state, by = c("grad.year" = "hs.grad.year", "countyfp")) %>%
  select(-grad.year, -countyfp)

write_csv(avgwages.master, "Data/SLEDS/Masters/avgwages_master.csv")

kable(names(master.13))

kable(head(master.13))
```

<br>

The new master dataset has `r comma(nrow(master.13))` rows and `r comma(ncol(master.13))` columns.

<br>
